description: This notification is generated when an ipsec Phase-1
IKE Tunnel becomes active.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD IPsecT1-MIB::ikeTunnelStart IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerLocalType i 1 IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerLocalValue s EXAMPLE IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerLocalAddr s EXAM IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerRemoteType i 1 IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerRemoteValue s EXAMPLE IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerRemoteAddr s EXAM IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerIntIndex i 9999 IPsecT1-MIB::ikeTunIndex i 9999

description: The type of local peer identity. The local peer may be
indentified by:
1. an IP address, or
2. a host name.
variables.name: IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerLocalType

description: The value of the local peer identity.
If the local peer type is an IP Address, then this
is the IP Address used to identify the local peer.
If the local peer type is a host name, then this is
the host name used to identify the local peer.
variables.name: IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerLocalValue

description: The IP address of the local peer.
variables.name: IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerLocalAddr

description: The type of remote peer identity. The remote peer may be
indentified by:
1. an IP address, or
2. a host name.
variables.name: IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerRemoteType

description: The value of the remote peer identity.
If the remote peer type is an IP Address, then this
is the IP Address used to identify the remote peer.
If the remote peer type is a host name, then this is
the host name used to identify the remote peer.
variables.name: IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerRemoteValue

description: The IP address of the remote peer.
variables.name: IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerRemoteAddr

description: The internal index of the local-remote peer association.
This internal index is used to uniquely identify
multiple associations between the local and remote peer.
variables.name: IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerIntIndex

description: The index of the ipsec Phase-1 IKE Tunnel Table.
The value of the index is a number which begins at one and
is incremented with each tunnel that is created. The value
of this object will wrap at 2,147,483,647.
variables.name: IPsecT1-MIB::ikeTunIndex

description: This notification is generated when an ipsec Phase-1
IKE Tunnel becomes inactive.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD IPsecT1-MIB::ikeTunnelStop IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerLocalType i 1 IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerLocalValue s EXAMPLE IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerLocalAddr s EXAM IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerRemoteType i 1 IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerRemoteValue s EXAMPLE IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerRemoteAddr s EXAM IPsecT1-MIB::ikePeerIntIndex i 9999 IPsecT1-MIB::ikeTunIndex i 9999

description: This notification is generated when the processing for

or system capacity error.

Tunnel becomes active.

Tunnel becomes inactive.

is incremented with each tunnel that is created. The value
of this object will wrap at 2,147,483,647.

Tunnel is terminated earily or before expected.

is incremented with each tunnel that is created. The value
of this object will wrap at 2,147,483,647.
